contents: Article 13 (Duties of Executive Directors) ① The Chairman represents the Foundation, supervises its affairs, and is responsible for the management performance of the Foundation during his term of office. ② The Executive Director assists the Chairman and performs the affairs of the Foundation in accordance with the organizational regulations. If the Chairman of the Board is unable to perform his/her duties due to unavoidable reasons, the Senior Executive Director in accordance with the organizational regulations shall be appointed. If both the Chairman and the Senior Standing Director are unable to perform their duties due to unavoidable reasons, the Executive Director appointed in advance by the Chairman of the Board. Perform duties in order. Revised on May 10, 2021. ③ When the Chairman, Senior Executive Director, and Executive Director are all unable to perform their duties due to unavoidable reasons, an officer designated by the Board of Directors shall perform their duties on their behalf. Revised July 20, 2015, July 11, 2019, ④ The audit shall audit the foundation's assets, accounting, and business execution status in accordance with the auditing standards set by the Minister of Strategy and Finance, and report the results to the Minister of Education, the Minister of Strategy and Finance, and It must be reported to the Board of Directors., ⑤ The Chairman of the Board of Directors must provide necessary support in terms of recruitment and placement of staff necessary to perform the duties of the auditor.
